category.text: $course$/Experiencing MIS, 9e (Kroenke)/022 Chapter Extension 10 Collaborative Information Systems for Student Projects

name.text: q001 ________ are useful when a team needs to meet on some topic but everyone ca

questiontext.text: ________ are useful when a team needs to meet on some topic but everyone cannot meet at the same time.

name.text: q002 Discussion forums are one of the nice-to-have features in a collaboration t

questiontext.text: Discussion forums are one of the nice-to-have features in a collaboration tool.

name.text: q003 Why should a team choose to use a collaboration information system?

questiontext.text: Why should a team choose to use a collaboration information system?

graderinfo.text: Collaboration is critical in business, and numerous software vendors and open source developers have created computer programs to facilitate various collaborative tasks. Once a team learns how to use the tools and has developed procedures for using them, teamwork will be easier. The team will no longer need to get everyone together face-to-face. It will no longer lose documents; it will be able to determine who is contributing and who is not. Another reason for using collaboration tools is that it will create better results. Such systems facilitate feedback and iteration. Each team member can produce documents, and others can comment and make revisions to them.

name.text: q004 Synchronous communication is said to occur if ________.

questiontext.text: Synchronous communication is said to occur if ________.

answer.text: communication occurs between people in different time zones
there is a flow of communication according to the hierarchical structure
members of various teams work on the same task
all members of a team meet at the same time

name.text: q005 VOICE is a marketing and media firm. One of its corporate policies is the s

questiontext.text: VOICE is a marketing and media firm. One of its corporate policies is the sole use of synchronous communication within the organization. VOICE is expanding its customer base in the coming year and needs to prepare a plan of action. Given its corporate policy regarding communication, which of the following modes are its team members most likely to use?

name.text: q006 ________ occurs when team members do not meet at the same time.

questiontext.text: ________ occurs when team members do not meet at the same time.

name.text: q007 AKAI One, a multinational company, has centers in four different countries.

questiontext.text: AKAI One, a multinational company, has centers in four different countries. The heads of the four centers set performance targets every month and work toward achieving them. Given that each center works in a different time zone, which of the following modes of communication should the center heads choose to discuss their monthly targets?

name.text: q008 Morgan's company has outsourced its accounting process to a small firm in I

questiontext.text: Morgan's company has outsourced its accounting process to a small firm in India. Morgan needs to discuss some quality control measures with the firm's managers. He conducts the meeting via videoconference. Given the nature of the meeting, it can also be called a(n) ________ meeting.

name.text: q009 If a virtual meeting is synchronous, participants can interact with each ot

questiontext.text: If a virtual meeting is synchronous, participants can interact with each other through ________.

name.text: q010 ________ are virtual meetings in which attendees view one of the attendees'

questiontext.text: ________ are virtual meetings in which attendees view one of the attendees' computer screens for formal and organized presentations.

name.text: q011 ________ is a type of asynchronous communication in which a group member ca

questiontext.text: ________ is a type of asynchronous communication in which a group member can post an entry, an idea, a comment, or a question, and other group members respond to it later, at their convenience.

name.text: q012 ________ is a type of asynchronous communication where one person creates a

questiontext.text: ________ is a type of asynchronous communication where one person creates a list of questions to which other users respond.

name.text: q013 Asynchronous communication occurs when team members do not meet at the same

questiontext.text: Asynchronous communication occurs when team members do not meet at the same time.

name.text: q014 A face-to-face meeting is an example of asynchronous communication.

questiontext.text: A face-to-face meeting is an example of asynchronous communication.

name.text: q015 Virtual meetings can be synchronous or asynchronous.

questiontext.text: Virtual meetings can be synchronous or asynchronous.

name.text: q016 Wikis are a virtual meeting in which attendees view one of the attendees' c

questiontext.text: Wikis are a virtual meeting in which attendees view one of the attendees' computer screens for a more formal and organized presentation.

name.text: q017 Videoconferencing is likely to be less intrusive than text chat.

questiontext.text: Videoconferencing is likely to be less intrusive than text chat.

name.text: q018 Email is a tool used for synchronous communication.

questiontext.text: Email is a tool used for synchronous communication.

name.text: q019 In team surveys, one team member creates a list of questions and the other

questiontext.text: In team surveys, one team member creates a list of questions and the other team members respond.

name.text: q020 Explain synchronous and asynchronous communications in organizations with e

questiontext.text: Explain synchronous and asynchronous communications in organizations with examples.

graderinfo.text: Synchronous communication occurs when all team members meet at the same time. Face-to-face meetings and conference calls are examples of synchronous communication. Asynchronous communication occurs when team members do not meet at the same time. Email, discussion forums, and team surveys are examples of asynchronous communication. Virtual meetings in which participants do not meet in the same place and possibly not at the same time can be both synchronous and asynchronous. If the virtual meeting is synchronous (all meet at the same time), participants can use conference calls, webinars, or multiparty text chat. A webinar is a virtual meeting in which attendees view one of the attendees' computer screens for a more formal and organized presentation. Videoconferencing is another synchronous method. When a team must meet asynchronously, most members try to communicate via email.

name.text: q021 Which of the following is a content sharing technique which is least effect

questiontext.text: Which of the following is a content sharing technique which is least effective for collaborations in which there are many document versions or for which there is a desire for content control?

name.text: q022 Which of the following statements is TRUE of shared content with version ma

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE of shared content with version management?

answer.text: Content sharing methods that provide version management cannot accommodate concurrent work.
Version management systems provide version control.
Version management makes it impossible to know when and by whom the document was changed.
Content sharing systems that provide version management can track changes to documents.

name.text: q023 Which of the following tools helps share content with version management fe

questiontext.text: Which of the following tools helps share content with version management features?

name.text: q024 Which of the following statements is TRUE of Google Drive?

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE of Google Drive?

answer.text: Users receive an email when a document is made available to them.
Documents are stored on the Google Drive server.
Document revisions are tracked with extensive details of changes made.
Microsoft Excel documents cannot be uploaded to Google Drive.

name.text: q025 Which of the following systems provides version control while sharing conte

questiontext.text: Which of the following systems provides version control while sharing content?

name.text: q026 In version control systems, shared documents are placed into shared directo

questiontext.text: In version control systems, shared documents are placed into shared directories called ________.

name.text: q027 Which of the following statements is TRUE of Microsoft SharePoint?

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE of Microsoft SharePoint?

answer.text: It does not facilitate permission-limited activity.
It converts shared documents to the Google Docs format.
It facilitates the continuation of workflow defined for a document even when any of its members disapproves the document.
It does not allow users to edit a document if it has been checked out by another user.

name.text: q028 The degree of version management is very high in email with attachments.

questiontext.text: The degree of version management is very high in email with attachments.

name.text: q029 Storing documents on servers is better than using email attachments because

questiontext.text: Storing documents on servers is better than using email attachments because documents have a single storage location.

name.text: q030 Version management systems facilitate tracking changes to documents and pro

questiontext.text: Version management systems facilitate tracking changes to documents and provide features and functions to accommodate concurrent work.

name.text: q031 Natalie needs to access Google Drive for a project. She does not need to ha

questiontext.text: Natalie needs to access Google Drive for a project. She does not need to have a Gmail account for that.

name.text: q032 Version management systems provide version control.

questiontext.text: Version management systems provide version control.

name.text: q033 In version control systems, shared documents are placed in shared directori

questiontext.text: In version control systems, shared documents are placed in shared directories, sometimes called libraries.

name.text: q034 The document checkout feature in SharePoint allows users to simultaneously

questiontext.text: The document checkout feature in SharePoint allows users to simultaneously edit documents.

name.text: q035 Workflows cannot be defined on Microsoft SharePoint for multistage business

questiontext.text: Workflows cannot be defined on Microsoft SharePoint for multistage business processes.

name.text: q036 What is version management and why is it important?

questiontext.text: What is version management and why is it important?

graderinfo.text: Every collaborative project involves sharing of content. Although email is simple, easy, and readily available, it will not suffice for collaborations in which there are many document versions or for which there is a desire for content control. Storing documents on servers is better than using email attachments because documents have a single storage location. They are not scattered in different team members' email boxes. However, without any version management it will be impossible to know who changed the document and when. Version management is a technique used for sharing electronic content. Systems that provide version management track changes to documents and provide features and functions to accommodate concurrent work. Google Drive and Microsoft One Drive are examples of systems that provide version management.

name.text: q037 Explain version control with a simple example.

questiontext.text: Explain version control with a simple example.

graderinfo.text: Version control is the process of limiting the actions that can be taken by a particular user on shared documents. Version management systems improve the tracking of shared content and potentially eliminate problems caused by concurrent document access. They do not, however, provide version control. With version control systems, each team member is given an account with a set of permissions. Shared documents are placed into shared directories, which are sometimes called libraries. Furthermore, document directories can be set up so that users are required to check out documents before they can modify them. When a document is checked out, no other user can obtain it for the purpose of editing it. Once the document has been checked in, other users can obtain it for editing. Microsoft SharePoint is the most popular version control application for general business.

name.text: q038 Which of the following statements is TRUE of collaboration tools?

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE of collaboration tools?

answer.text: Team members cannot request SharePoint to send emails when certain events occur.
Google Drive permits only the uploader to make changes to a task list and does not allow simultaneous edits.
The standard task list in SharePoint can readily be modified to include user-customized columns using SharePoint.
Google Drive allows only one user to edit a document at a time.

name.text: q039 Ashley is part of an interdepartmental project in which members from differ

questiontext.text: Ashley is part of an interdepartmental project in which members from different departments work on the project and upload their files on Google Drive. Which of the following characteristics should Ashley keep in mind while working on this project?

answer.text: Google Drive restricts the edit permission on documents to the creator of tasks.
Google Drive does not allow simultaneous edits.
Google Drive deals with video and audio files.
Google Drive provides version history showing the changes made by users to task lists.

name.text: q040 The alerts feature in SharePoint ________.

questiontext.text: The alerts feature in SharePoint ________.

answer.text: sends a team member an email whenever a task is assigned to him or her
requires team members to check the task list for new tasks every hour
does not support customization of email requests
can send emails only when an existing task is deleted

name.text: q041 SharePoint can be configured to send email alerts when certain events occur

questiontext.text: SharePoint can be configured to send email alerts when certain events occur.

name.text: q042 SharePoint includes a built-in content type for managing task lists that pr

questiontext.text: SharePoint includes a built-in content type for managing task lists that provides robust and powerful features.

name.text: q043 Explain the importance of Microsoft SharePoint in task management.

questiontext.text: Explain the importance of Microsoft SharePoint in task management.

graderinfo.text: Microsoft SharePoint has a robust task management capability. It contains a built-in content type for managing task lists that provides powerful features. The standard task list stores data such as title, assigned to, due date, status, predecessors, and other useful task data. Users can also add their own data to the default format of the task list. With SharePoint, it is possible to filter task lists to show only incomplete tasks, or only tasks that have been completed. Alerts are a feature in SharePoint task lists that can send emails to a team member when certain events occur. If a task is assigned to a person, alerts can send an email. This feature means that team members need not continually check the task list for new tasks.

name.text: q044 With the ________ collaboration tool set, a participant should be able to c

questiontext.text: With the ________ collaboration tool set, a participant should be able to collaborate with his or her team, though he or she will get little support from the software.

questiontext.text: With the ________ collaboration tool set, participants have the ability to conduct multiparty audio and video virtual meetings and the support for concurrent access to document, spreadsheet, and presentation files, but they will have to rely on third-party tools to use surveys, wikis, and blogs.

name.text: q046 The ________ collaboration tool set has a large set of features, including

questiontext.text: The ________ collaboration tool set has a large set of features, including content management and control, workflow control, online meetings in which participants can view shared whiteboards, applications, and monitors.

name.text: q047 Which of the following statements is TRUE of collaboration tool sets?

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE of collaboration tool sets?

answer.text: The Good collaboration tool set has built-in discussion boards.
The Comprehensive collaboration tool set takes the longest time to learn.
The Good collaboration tool set includes workflow control as an inbuilt feature.
The Minimal collaboration tool set allows sharing of video files.

name.text: q048 Which of the following statements is TRUE of a product power curve for coll

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE of a product power curve for collaborative tool sets?

answer.text: A flat line on a power curve means the user is increasing the utility gained from the product.
At time zero, the ideal power curve is at zero.
The power curve of a Minimal collaboration tool set rises steadily with time.
The power curve of a Comprehensive collaboration tool set has a longer flat spot in the beginning.

name.text: q049 With the Minimal collaboration tool set, a participant should be able to co

questiontext.text: With the Minimal collaboration tool set, a participant should be able to collaborate with his or her team, though he or she will get little support from the software.

name.text: q050 The Good collaboration tool set includes content management and control, wo

questiontext.text: The Good collaboration tool set includes content management and control, workflow control, online meetings in which participants can view shared whiteboards, applications, and monitors.

name.text: q051 In the product power curve, the Minimal product set has some power at time

questiontext.text: In the product power curve, the Minimal product set has some power at time zero.

name.text: q052 While using the Minimal collaboration tool set, it must be ensured that one

questiontext.text: While using the Minimal collaboration tool set, it must be ensured that one user's work does not conflict with another's.

name.text: q053 What are the three sets of collaboration tools?

questiontext.text: What are the three sets of collaboration tools?

graderinfo.text:
The three sets of collaboration tools are the Minimal, Good, and Comprehensive tool sets. Their features are as follows:
1. The Minimal collaboration tool set has the minimum possible set of tools. With this set, a participant should be able to collaborate with his or her team, though he or she will get little support from the software.
2. With the Good collaboration tool set, a participant will have the ability to conduct multiparty audio and video virtual meetings, and he or she will also have support for concurrent access to document, spreadsheet, and presentation files.
3. The Comprehensive collaboration tool set has a full set of features, including content management and control, workflow control, online meetings in which participants can view shared whiteboards, applications, and monitors.

questiontext.text: A leader does not have to consider people in choosing a collaboration tool set — cost is most important.

name.text: q068 Briefly describe some nice-to-have features, as opposed to essential featur

questiontext.text: Briefly describe some nice-to-have features, as opposed to essential features, in the context of collaboration tool sets.

graderinfo.text: The features in the 'nice-to-have' category are not essential, but they can make teamwork easier and more effective. Also, some of these features might be required for certain types of projects. Discussion forums are useful when the team needs to meet on some topic but everyone cannot meet at the same time. Surveys obtain team members' opinions outside of team meetings as well. Wikis are useful for documenting team knowledge; blogs enable team members to publish their ideas. Sharing photos and videos can be a great way of building team cohesion.

questiontext.text: ________ is an example of a real-time surveying software.

questiontext.text: It is impossible to switch from Word documents to Google documents.

questiontext.text: All of the following allow automatic version control except ________.

questiontext.text: Good project managers make sure every team meeting ends with an updated task list.

name.text: q073 Since everyone understands computers, it is not necessary to think about th

questiontext.text: Since everyone understands computers, it is not necessary to think about the procedure and people components when choosing a collaborative information system.

category.text: $course$/Experiencing MIS, 9e (Kroenke)/023 Chapter Extension 11 Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) Systems

questiontext.text: The primary purpose of an enterprise resource planning (ERP) system is integration.

questiontext.text: What is the primary purpose of an enterprise resource planning (ERP) system?

questiontext.text: Who among the following is a part of a supply chain activity?

answer.text: Jonathan, who is in charge of capacity planning
Zara, who is the head of marketing

name.text: q005 Which of the following is a manufacturing activity that must be included in

questiontext.text: Which of the following is a manufacturing activity that must be included in a true enterprise resource planning (ERP) product?

name.text: q006 Customer relationship management (CRM), as an application that must be incl

questiontext.text: Customer relationship management (CRM), as an application that must be included in a true enterprise resource planning (ERP) product, includes ________.

name.text: q007 ________ activities include payroll, time and attendance, and benefits admi

questiontext.text: ________ activities include payroll, time and attendance, and benefits administration that must be integrated into applications in order to form a true enterprise resource planning (ERP) product.

name.text: q008 The process of maintaining a general ledger, which must be integrated into

questiontext.text: The process of maintaining a general ledger, which must be integrated into applications in order to form a true enterprise resource planning (ERP) product, is a(n) ________ activity.

name.text: q009 In ________, many enterprise resource planning customers will be able to st

questiontext.text: In ________, many enterprise resource planning customers will be able to store most of their data on cloud servers managed by cloud vendors and store sensitive data on servers that they manage themselves.

name.text: q010 Which of the following statements is TRUE of an enterprise resource plannin

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE of an enterprise resource planning (ERP) database?

answer.text: An ERP solution contains the company's operational data.
A stored procedure is a computer program code stored within an ERP database that runs to keep the database consistent when certain conditions arise.
An ERP solution includes initial configuration data.
A trigger is a computer program code stored in an ERP database that is used to enforce business rules.

name.text: q011 Which of the following statements describes a trigger?

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements describes a trigger?

answer.text: It is a computer program stored within a database that runs to keep the database consistent when certain conditions arise.
It is a computer program stored in a database that is used to enforce business rules.
It is a set of inherent procedures in an enterprise resource planning (ERP) solution that implement standard business processes.
It is a programming paradigm that describes computation in terms of statements that change a program state.

name.text: q012 What is a stored procedure?

questiontext.text: What is a stored procedure?

answer.text: It is a computer program stored within a database that runs to keep the database consistent when certain conditions arise.
It is an area of memory that is used for dynamic memory allocation.
It is a computer program stored in a database that is used to enforce business rules.
It is a software program that houses and serves business logic for use by multiple applications.

name.text: q013 As an element of an enterprise resource planning (ERP) solution, supply cha

questiontext.text: As an element of an enterprise resource planning (ERP) solution, supply chain includes scheduling, capacity planning, quality control, bill of materials, and related activities.

name.text: q014 Enterprise resource planning (ERP) vendors design application programs to b

questiontext.text: Enterprise resource planning (ERP) vendors design application programs to be configurable so that development teams can alter them to meet customer requirements without changing program code.

name.text: q015 An enterprise resource planning (ERP) solution includes a database design,

questiontext.text: An enterprise resource planning (ERP) solution includes a database design, initial configuration data, and the company's operational data.

name.text: q016 A stored procedure is a computer program stored within a database that runs

questiontext.text: A stored procedure is a computer program stored within a database that runs to keep the database consistent when certain conditions arise.

name.text: q017 An example of a stored procedure would be never to sell certain items at a

questiontext.text: An example of a stored procedure would be never to sell certain items at a discount.

name.text: q018 Process blueprints are the inherent processes in an enterprise resource pla

questiontext.text: Process blueprints are the inherent processes in an enterprise resource planning (ERP) solution that implement standard business processes.

name.text: q019 Enterprise resource planning (ERP) training includes topics such as obtaini

questiontext.text: Enterprise resource planning (ERP) training includes topics such as obtaining top-level management support.

name.text: q020 The enterprise resource planning (ERP) training sessions in which the imple

questiontext.text: The enterprise resource planning (ERP) training sessions in which the implementing organization's employees teach the ERP trainers about the organization's processes are called train the trainer.

name.text: q021 Explain enterprise resource planning (ERP) application programs.

questiontext.text: Explain enterprise resource planning (ERP) application programs.

graderinfo.text:
ERP vendors design application programs to be configurable so that development teams can alter them to meet customer requirements without changing program code. Accordingly, during the ERP development process, the development team sets configuration parameters that specify how ERP application programs will operate.
There are limits to how much configuration can be done. If a new ERP customer has requirements that cannot be met via program configuration, then it either needs to adapt its business to what the software can do or write, or pay another vendor to write, an application code to meet its requirement. Thus, choosing an ERP solution that has applications that function close to the organization's requirements is critically important to success.

name.text: q022 Which of the following tasks should be considered while implementing an ent

questiontext.text: Which of the following tasks should be considered while implementing an enterprise resource planning (ERP) application?

answer.text: creating an as-is model that summarizes current business procedures and practices
plunging the organization into the new system
modeling all current practices "as-is" and implementing them on ERP application
modifying every existing practice to match blueprint models

name.text: q023 For implementing enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems, the first task

questiontext.text: For implementing enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems, the first task is to create a model of current business procedures and practices, which is called the as-is model.

name.text: q024 The differences between as-is processes and the blueprint should be reconci

questiontext.text: The differences between as-is processes and the blueprint should be reconciled after the enterprise resource planning (ERP) system has been implemented.

name.text: q025 A new enterprise resource planning (ERP) implementation process cannot be c

questiontext.text: A new enterprise resource planning (ERP) implementation process cannot be carried out if a business is running on an old system.

name.text: q026 An enterprise resource planning (ERP) implementation depends primarily on t

questiontext.text: An enterprise resource planning (ERP) implementation depends primarily on the backing of a departmental manager.

name.text: q027 Explain briefly the steps for implementing enterprise resource planning (ER

questiontext.text: Explain briefly the steps for implementing enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems.

graderinfo.text:
The first task in implementing Foundations of Health Informatics is to create a model of current business procedures and practices, which is called the as-is model. Managers and analysts then compare those as-is processes to the ERP process blueprints and note differences. The company then must find ways to eliminate the differences, either by changing the existing business process to match the ERP process or by altering the ERP system.
Once the differences between as-is processes and the blueprint have been reconciled, the next step is to implement the system. Before implementation starts, however, users must be trained on the new processes, procedures, and use of the ERP system's features and function. Additionally, the company needs to conduct a simulation test of the new system to identify problems. Then, the organization must convert its data, procedures, and personnel to the new ERP system. All of this happens while the business continues to run on the old system.

name.text: q028 Which of the following aspects that impact enterprise resource planning (ER

questiontext.text: Which of the following aspects that impact enterprise resource planning (ERP) differs among companies of different sizes?

answer.text: relevance of Foundations of Health Informatics

name.text: q029 Which of the following statements is TRUE of the impact of enterprise resou

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE of the impact of enterprise resource planning (ERP) on the IT staff of small organizations?

answer.text: IT specialists in small organizations are dedicated to managing only the ERP system.
The IT staff in small organizations is isolated from senior management.
The chief information officer obtains the backing of the entire executive group for ERP implementation.
IT specialists in small organizations are spread very thin and often are in over their heads during an ERP implementation.

name.text: q030 Nolan works for a food processing company that has an annual sales of $200

questiontext.text: Nolan works for a food processing company that has an annual sales of $200 million. He heads the IT department in his organization. Given that Nolan's organization is midsized, which of the following statements is most likely to be TRUE of the effect of enterprise resource planning (ERP) on his department's staff?

answer.text: His staff is often isolated from senior management.
ERP implementation in his organization will be part of a strategic process and, once begun, will have the full backing of the entire executive group.
Specialists in his department are spread very thin and often are in over their heads during an ERP implementation.
His organization employs only one or two IT specialists.

name.text: q031 Which of the following statements is TRUE of the types of organizations tha

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE of the types of organizations that use enterprise resource planning (ERP)?

answer.text: ERP vendors started selling ERP solutions to distributors after their success with the manufacturing industry.
Implementing ERP in organizations of different scales is difficult due to the differences in their basic business processes.
ERP procedures are uniform in large organizations operating in multiple countries.
Availability of IT personnel does not have an impact on ERP implementation.

name.text: q032 Enterprise resource planning (ERP) was initially adopted by government and

questiontext.text: Enterprise resource planning (ERP) was initially adopted by government and public service agencies to handle complex administrative tasks.

name.text: q033 Small organizations tend to employ only one or two IT specialists who not o

questiontext.text: Small organizations tend to employ only one or two IT specialists who not only manage the enterprise resource planning (ERP) system, but the entire IS department as well.

name.text: q034 In midsized organizations, the first step in moving toward enterprise resou

questiontext.text: In midsized organizations, the first step in moving toward enterprise resource planning (ERP) is to obtain deep senior-level management commitment to the project.

name.text: q035 Explain how organizations of different sizes use enterprise resource planni

questiontext.text: Explain how organizations of different sizes use enterprise resource planning (ERP) differently.

graderinfo.text:
Companies of different sizes have one very important difference that has a major impact on ERP: the availability of skilled IT personnel. Small organizations employ only one or two IT specialists who not only manage the ERP system, but the entire IS department as well. They are spread very thin and often are in over their heads during an ERP implementation. Smaller, simpler ERP solutions are common among these companies.
Midsized organizations expand IT from one person to a small staff, but frequently this staff is isolated from senior management. Such isolation creates misunderstanding and distrust. Because of the expense, organizational disruption, and length of ERP projects, senior management must be committed to the ERP solution. When IT management is isolated, such commitment is difficult to obtain and may not be strong. This issue is so prevalent that many ERP consultants say the first step in moving toward ERP is to obtain deep senior-level management commitment to the project.
Large organizations have a full IT staff that is headed by the chief information officer (CIO), who is a business and IT professional who sits on the executive board and is an active participant in organizational strategic planning. ERP implementation will be part of that strategic process and, once begun, will have the full backing of the entire executive group.

name.text: q036 ________ , purchased by Koch Equity in 2017, offers Business Cloud, an ente

questiontext.text: ________ , purchased by Koch Equity in 2017, offers Business Cloud, an enterprise resource planning (ERP) solution that can be used as a software service, can be installed on the customer's servers and managed by personnel.

name.text: q047 PeopleSoft is an HR product developed in-house by Oracle.

questiontext.text: PeopleSoft is an HR product developed in-house by Oracle.

name.text: q048 Microsoft offers its CRM product online as SaaS (software as a service), bu

questiontext.text: Microsoft offers its CRM product online as SaaS (software as a service), but it has no full enterprise resource planning (ERP) implementation in the cloud.

name.text: q049 Briefly describe Microsoft's enterprise resource planning (ERP) products.

questiontext.text: Briefly describe Microsoft's enterprise resource planning (ERP) products.

graderinfo.text:
Microsoft offers five ERP products, all obtained via acquisition: AX, Nav, GP, Solomon, and Dynamics CRM. AX and Nav have the most capabilities; GP is more limited but is easier to use. The future of Solomon is uncertain. Dynamics CRM is primarily a CRM product, but it is extensible in ways that enable customers to use it for ERP as well as CRM.
Microsoft is in the process of consolidating its offerings. Most likely AX will continue going forward as a true ERP product for larger organizations. Dynamics CRM will serve as a CRM product as well as a platform for custom ERP solutions. GP, which is the easiest of the products to install, will continue as a general-ledger program that can also be used as a platform for simpler ERP solutions.
Microsoft relies heavily on its network of independent software vendors to create customer solutions using the Dynamics platform. These vendors take off-the-shelf Dynamics products and adapt and customize them for particular situations. Microsoft offers its CRM product online as SaaS, but it has no full ERP implementation in the cloud.

name.text: q050 Briefly explain Infor's enterprise resource planning (ERP) products.

questiontext.text: Briefly explain Infor's enterprise resource planning (ERP) products.

graderinfo.text:
After Infor was purchased by private-equity investors, it bought many ERP companies. It now sells many ERP products for many different industries. These products vary in purpose, scope, and quality. They span the midrange, serving higher-end small companies and lower-end large companies.
Recently, Infor began to offer the Infor Business Cloud, an ERP solution that can be used as a software service, can be installed on the customer's servers and managed by Infor personnel, or can be installed in a bare-bones ways and offered as IaaS.

category.text: $course$/Experiencing MIS, 9e (Kroenke)/024 Chapter Extension 12 Supply Chain Management

name.text: q001 Which of the following statements is TRUE of an inter-enterprise system?

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE of an inter-enterprise system?

answer.text: It is constant in scope and complexity.
It cannot be customized to the needs of organizations.
It is shared by two or more independent organizations.
It is easier to manage than other types of systems.

name.text: q002 Many organizations can share a single inter-enterprise information system.

questiontext.text: Many organizations can share a single inter-enterprise information system.

name.text: q003 The Automated Clearing House system among banks is an example of a standard

questiontext.text: The Automated Clearing House system among banks is an example of a standardized inter-enterprise system.

name.text: q004 Explain inter-enterprise IS processes with an example.

questiontext.text: Explain inter-enterprise IS processes with an example.

graderinfo.text: An inter-enterprise is an information system that is shared by two or more independent organizations. Inter-enterprise IS varies in scope and complexity. An example of a simple inter-enterprise IS includes a sales process at a small retailer in which the retailer processes customers' credit card transactions. The retailer, customer, and credit card company (and possibly the bank that issued the card) are all part of the business process that processes the payment.

name.text: q005 Which of the following refers to a network of organizations and facilities

questiontext.text: Which of the following refers to a network of organizations and facilities that transforms raw materials into products delivered to customers?

Not every supply chain has distributors and retailers.
Each element in the supply chain can be connected to only one entity up and down.
The only source of revenue in a supply chain is the retailer.

questiontext.text: Each level of a supply chain has a distinct source of revenue.

for the evaluation of the demand for furniture for a given period

answer.text: Managing an inventory requires balancing between availability and cost.

name.text: q014 Which of the following factors influences supply chain performance by affec

questiontext.text: Which of the following factors influences supply chain performance by affecting the ways that organizations in the supply chain request, respond, and update one another?

name.text: q016 Which of the following refers to the way organizations share their informat

name.text: q017 ________ refers to the methods by which information is transmitted.

questiontext.text: ________ refers to the methods by which information is transmitted.

name.text: q018 As a factor affecting supply chain performance, inventory includes all of t

questiontext.text: As a factor affecting supply chain performance, inventory includes all of the materials in the supply chain, including raw materials, in-process work, and finished goods.

name.text: q019 Increasing the size of an inventory reduces the cost of the inventory.

questiontext.text: Increasing the size of an inventory reduces the cost of the inventory.

name.text: q020 Decreasing the size of an inventory decreases the odds that an item will be

questiontext.text: Decreasing the size of an inventory decreases the odds that an item will be unavailable for purchase.

name.text: q021 What is a supply chain? What are the four drivers that are crucial to the s

questiontext.text: What is a supply chain? What are the four drivers that are crucial to the success of a supply chain?

graderinfo.text: A supply chain is a network of organizations and facilities that transform raw materials into products delivered to customers. In a typical supply chain, customers order from retailers, who, in turn, order from distributors, who, in turn, order from manufacturers, who, in turn, order from suppliers. The supply chain also includes transportation companies, warehouses, and inventories, and some means for transmitting messages and information among the organizations involved. Four major factors, or drivers, affect supply chain performance: facilities, inventory, transportation, and information.

name.text: q022 ________ is the difference between the sum of the revenue generated by the

questiontext.text: ________ is the difference between the sum of the revenue generated by the supply chain and the sum of the costs that all organizations in the supply chain incur to obtain that revenue.

name.text: q023 Each organization in a supply chain is an independent company with its own

questiontext.text: Each organization in a supply chain is an independent company with its own objectives.

name.text: q024 Profitability of a supply chain increases if all the organizations in the s

questiontext.text: Profitability of a supply chain increases if all the organizations in the supply chain operate at their maximum profitability.

name.text: q025 Define supply chain profitability. How is it different from individual orga

questiontext.text: Define supply chain profitability. How is it different from individual organizational profitability?

graderinfo.text: Supply chain profitability is the difference between the sum of the revenue generated by the supply chain and the sum of the costs that all organizations in the supply chain incur to obtain that revenue. In general, the maximum profit to the supply chain will not occur if each organization in the supply chain maximizes its own profits in isolation. Usually, the profitability of the supply chain increases if one or more of the organizations operate at less than their own maximum profitability.

name.text: q026 The phenomenon in which the variability in the size and timing of orders in

questiontext.text: The phenomenon in which the variability in the size and timing of orders increases at each stage up the supply chain is referred to as the ________.

name.text: q027 Which of the following statements is TRUE of the bullwhip effect?

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE of the bullwhip effect?

answer.text: It forces suppliers and manufacturers to carry smaller inventories than necessary.
It is a natural dynamic that occurs because of the multistage nature of the supply chain.
It is strongly associated with erratic consumer demand.
It increases the overall profitability of the supply chain.

name.text: q028 Juicebox Inc., a fruit juice processing company, has been facing irregular

questiontext.text: Juicebox Inc., a fruit juice processing company, has been facing irregular demand patterns for the last two years. These large fluctuations have created a bullwhip effect for the company. Which of the following steps will Juicebox Inc. most likely take to cope with this effect?

answer.text: reduce its annual production of juice
reduce the number of employees to cut costs

name.text: q029 The bullwhip effect explains the amplification of demand at various stages

questiontext.text: The bullwhip effect explains the amplification of demand at various stages of a supply chain.

name.text: q030 The large fluctuations of the bullwhip effect force organizations to stock

questiontext.text: The large fluctuations of the bullwhip effect force organizations to stock fewer inventories than needed.

name.text: q031 The bullwhip effect increases if all the participants in the supply chain h

questiontext.text: The bullwhip effect increases if all the participants in the supply chain have an access to consumer-demand information from the retailer.

name.text: q032 Inter-enterprise information systems are necessary to share consumer-demand

questiontext.text: Inter-enterprise information systems are necessary to share consumer-demand information.

name.text: q033 True demand is the demand from the only party that introduces money into th

questiontext.text: True demand is the demand from the only party that introduces money into the system.

name.text: q034 Explain the bullwhip effect with an example.

questiontext.text: Explain the bullwhip effect with an example.

graderinfo.text:
The bullwhip effect is a phenomenon in which the variability in the size and timing of orders increases at each stage up the supply chain, from customer to supplier. In a famous study, the bullwhip effect was observed in Procter & Gamble's supply chain for diapers. The number of babies determines diaper demand, and that number is constant or possibly slowly changing.
Retailers do not order from the distributor with the sale of every diaper package. The retailer waits until the diaper inventory falls below a certain level, called the reorder quantity. Then the retailer orders a supply of diapers, perhaps ordering a few more than it expects to sell to ensure that it does not have an outage. The distributor receives the retailer's orders and follows the same process. It waits until its supply falls below the reorder quantity, and then it reorders from the manufacturer, with perhaps an increased amount to prevent outages. The manufacturer, in turn, uses a similar process with the raw-materials suppliers.
Because of the nature of this process, small changes in demand at the retailer are amplified at each stage of the supply chain. These small changes become quite large variations on the supplier end. The large fluctuations of the bullwhip effect force distributors, manufacturers, and suppliers to carry larger inventories than should be necessary to meet the real consumer demand. Thus, the bullwhip effect reduces the overall profitability of the supply chain.

name.text: q035 Which of the following is used as the measure of supply chain speed?

questiontext.text: Which of the following is used as the measure of supply chain speed?

answer.text: dollar value of goods exchanged in a given period of time
amount of goods exchanged in a given period of time
total profit generated by the components of supply chain
time taken to transport goods from one component to another

name.text: q036 Zim-ware, a kitchenware brand, recently started selling its products online

questiontext.text: Zim-ware, a kitchenware brand, recently started selling its products online. It plans to increase the sale of its products using e-commerce. Which of the following is Zim-ware most likely to experience as a result of this system change?

answer.text: reduced costs of buying and selling
increased size and costs of inventories

name.text: q037 The cloud storage has increased the costs of integrating an organization's

questiontext.text: The cloud storage has increased the costs of integrating an organization's information systems.

name.text: q038 Information systems have the capability to eliminate or greatly reduce the

questiontext.text: Information systems have the capability to eliminate or greatly reduce the bullwhip effect.

name.text: q039 Information systems do not support just-in-time inventory.

questiontext.text: Information systems do not support just-in-time inventory.

name.text: q040 How do information systems affect supply chain performance?

questiontext.text: How do information systems affect supply chain performance?

graderinfo.text: Information systems, such as customer relationship management (CRM) and e-commerce sales systems have dramatically reduced the costs of buying and selling. Sourcing, buying, and selling have all become faster, easier, more effective, and less costly. Distributed systems in the cloud have enabled businesses to integrate their information systems with less cost and greater speed and agility than ever before. The presence of information systems has also expanded supply chain speed. Information systems have enabled both suppliers and customers to reduce the size of their inventories and, thus, reduce their inventory costs. Information systems also improve delivery scheduling. Using information systems, suppliers can deliver materials and components at the time and in the sequence needed. Such delivery enables just-in-time inventory, and it allows manufacturers to reduce raw materials inventory size as well as the handling of raw materials.

name.text: q041 When Disney Studios and Pixar Studios share an information system, they are

questiontext.text: When Disney Studios and Pixar Studios share an information system, they are using ________.

questiontext.text: ________ occurs when a company such as Dell omits a part of the supply chain relationship and sells directly to the consumer.

questiontext.text: Managing inventory requires balancing between ________ and ________.

name.text: q046 The maximum profit to the supply chain will occur if organization in the su

questiontext.text: The maximum profit to the supply chain will occur if organization in the supply chain maximizes its one profits.

name.text: q048 What is one way to eliminate the bullwhip effect?

questiontext.text: What is one way to eliminate the bullwhip effect?

answer.text: Force suppliers and manufacturers to carry smaller inventories.
Give all participants in the supply chain access to consumer-demand information from the retailer.
Send the same amount of inventory to every retail store on a monthly basis.

name.text: q049 Which of the following is a benefit of information systems on supply chain

questiontext.text: Which of the following is a benefit of information systems on supply chain performance?

answer.text: increase size and cost of inventories

name.text: q050 Retailers do not want to share sales data with the entire sales chain becau

questiontext.text: Retailers do not want to share sales data with the entire sales chain because it mainly benefits the supply chain.

name.text: q051 Inter-enterprise system management is much easier than management for other

questiontext.text: Inter-enterprise system management is much easier than management for other types of systems.

name.text: q052 Why is the term "chain" in supply chain management misleading?

questiontext.text: Why is the term "chain" in supply chain management misleading?

graderinfo.text: The term is misleading because chain implies that each organization is connected to just one company up (toward the supplier) and down (toward the customer) the chain. That is not the case. Instead, at each level, an organization can work with many organizations both up and down the supply chain. Thus, a supply chain and the processes that support it are networks.

name.text: q053 List the benefits of information systems on supply chain performance.

questiontext.text: List the benefits of information systems on supply chain performance.

graderinfo.text:
• Reduce costs of buying and selling
• Increase supply chain speed
• Reduce size and cost of inventories
• Improve delivery scheduling–enable JIT
• Fix bullwhip effect.
